alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued December 18 at 1:27PM HST until December 18 at 4:30PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Maui in Maui County * Until 430 PM HST. * At 127 PM HST, radar indicated heavy rain occurring across several areas of the island of Maui. Rain has been falling at a rate of 1.5 to 2.5 inches per hour since earlier this morning. Additonal heavy rainfall and thunderstorms will move across the county this afternoon. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Kahului, Kihei, Lahaina, Kula, Pukalani, Makawao, Keokea, Haliimaile, Paia, Puunene, Haiku-Pauwela, Wailea, Pauwela, Maalaea, Ulupalakua, Huelo, Makena, Waikapu, Wailuku and Waiehu. This warning may need to be extended beyond 430 PM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
